text: friends of Shira banki began arriving to
her high school soon after her death was
announced doctors say the 16 year old
died from her wounds after being stabbed
at a gay pride march in Jerusalem the
gay communities in Jerusalem and in
Israel is painful we have to keep
fighting and do everything and put all
our energy to keep fighting for her and
for everybody who was murdered for these
causes the teenager was one of six
people attacked last Thursday this man
an ultra Orthodox Jew was wrestled to
the ground and arrested at the scene
police say the suspect was released from
prison just three weeks ago for carrying
out a similar attack at pride in 2005 on
Friday he appeared before a Jerusalem
court for a remand hearing police have
come under criticism for not keeping him
under surveillance Israel's prime
minister has sent his condolences to the
teenagers family she laid on our meter
you know it's a common name Shira was a
brave girl she was murdered by a vile
person because she supported a simple
notion that everybody has the right to
live their lives
respectfully and with security the
despicable murderer who stabbed Shira
and five others try to undermine this
fundamental value
on Sunday night hundreds of members of
the gay community held a candlelight
vigil at Jerusalem's main square the gay
pride event has long been a source of
tension between Jerusalem's secular
majority and its Jewish Orthodox
communities but the violent outcome of
Thursday's parade has shocked all
Israelis Katerina MO
BBC News
